content: Fantastic. Really useful. My phone is about 0.5 of a stop off. Would be great to have a separate calibration setting, so that the plus/minus correction could just be used for working out placing the image in a particular zone etc, but hardly any inconvenience as is. A great app, love the spot meter zoomed in - super accurate. Other thoughts: if it could perform a screen grab to act as a reference, that would be cool for image review. Thank you for your work on this.
Like the light meter reading best.
Great app. Simple interface, accurate results. I use it often.
Only work twiceüò≠üò° why is this not working?????
replyContent: What are you seeing on your device? What's not working for you? Send me an email at dev@lightmeter.dev

content: Responsive developer. Awesome App with clean interface and useful features.
replyContent: I think I just pushed a fix, please let me know if it works.

content: Been using the free version but purchased this to remove ads and support the developer. Great app. My only suggestion would be to add a Multi-Spot averaging feature. Would be great if you could tap on 3 or 5 spots to meter and get an average exposure

Not working well for me, probably two stops short of proper exposure in an experiment I am trying to do. Not sure if it's confused in low light, or needs a manual to explain how to use it. Admittedly, I am new to light meters, but I pointed the screen side of the phone towards the light, and parallel to the light. I set ISO 400, 1/100s, and used the sensor mode with the default sensor. It said f/4.5, and as I said, probably -2 stops of a reasonable exposure. Samsung Galaxy Active 8, I think.
replyContent: It sounds like you're using it right. With the Sensor Meter you need to be directly towards the light source (no dome). A little trial and error may help. If you're seeing it consistently under-exposing, use the adjust values.

content: Returner to film after many years excellent accessory.
Excellent app and very responsive developer.
replyContent: Thanks for your help in figuring out what was going on!

content: Excellent tool so you always have a ight meter with you!
Does what I need, correct exposure.

Awful! Crashes every time I try to launch the camera or sensor meter functions. Fix it or refund my purchase. Update: installed the update as recommended; however, no difference. Still crashes every time.
replyContent: Let's give this one more try! I figured out some more possible crashes based on the logs and pushed a fix. The update should be available tomorrow (10/17). If it absolutely does not work still, please message me for a refund: dev@lightmeter.dev

content: Still learning how to use it. It seems helpful. Will come back to you later.
Tried a load of light meters, this is the best one - worth every penny. Especially if you shoot film üôÇüëçüèª
Great app, great customer service!
Works great and easy to use!
Surprisingly accurate and professional application!
Excellent and accurate for pinhole.
Nice phone meter. All the tools
I am enjoying the app. It is maybe not as accurate as a $500 spot meter but it does a nice job for my level of photography. Thanks and keep the updates flowing ;)

Best light metering app I've ever used. Very accurate metering results consistent with the ones from my EOS R. A possible improvement: is there any chance to indicate the focal length when zooming the camera?
For calculation of video exposure settings... AMAZING! WB functionality is peerless. Best app I've ever bought.
Awesome app. So simple. It just works! Would be so cool if you could customize settings (aperture, shutter speed) for specific cameras.... Or use it to record settings taken for photos...
There should be a reset button because if you use it for any length of time it doesn't appear to be very accurate. Taking a reading outdoors and then using it indoors may not change the settings.
purchased. nice app! thanks dev!
Works
All it says when I go to the app the app has stopped working so I'm not very happy seen as though I've just bought it.
replyContent: Hi Charles, I'll take a look to see if I can figure out what's going on. Was the free version working correctly for you?. I'm happy to issue a refund.

content: If your are a photographer or repro house color retoucher, this is your chouce

I feel like the spot metering isn't working for me on my Samsung Galaxy S8. I've tested it with high contrast lighting and it didn't show any change in Ev or other settings. Granted, I just started out with film photography, so I don't know much and hoped to find a cheap app to help me get the right exposure. Not sure how my pictures turned out yet. Edit: newest update does not fix the spot metering issue
replyContent: The latest version may have fixed the spot metering issue on some devices, please give it a try and let me know!

content: Only light meter app with histogram! Has lots of options and extras, but still easy and simple to use.

This app is a must have for anyone shooting vintage cameras. I used the the free version for a year before purchasing it. Compared to stand alone light meters costing hundreds of dollars, this is the better option. The best part is it's always with me.
Got the free version for the pixel 3 then immediately paid for it. Solid app for a photographer on the go!
Awesome, must have as good as any more expensive one.
Really love this light meter!!,...
Thanks Will! This is such a great tool and is helping me grow so much as a photographer!
I only have camera in the full product while the free product all features
replyContent: Are you still seeing this issue after the latest update? If so, please email me. The features between the two should be identical.

content: Great! Did a test roll with my 1947 Argus c3 and it worked perfect!
Must have
Works occasionally, at some point it just says 1/10 no matter where I aim my phone. The meter only seems to function when within 3 feet of the subject or when it wants to.
replyContent: Please try the new version I just published, it allows you to pick between the sensors on your device to find the most sensitive. Thanks!

content: Serves all my needs. Provides correct measurements.
The app is incredibly useful.
Could you add possibilities calculating correction for black and white photography filters, please? I mean, green, red, yellow, orange, yellow-green and infrared.
Awesome app!
Simple to use and a accurate as far as I can tell.

I tried the free version after forgetting my Sekonic while out taking night photos with a 1955 Fed 1G and Fuji Superia 400 film. I wasn't expecting much but all 35 images were correctly exposed. I have checked it against my meter and on my cheap UDGMI F1 it's very accurate.

App worked well after one photoshoot and it stopped functioning. The sensor feature stopped functioning after a single photoshoot (that's the function that I purchased the app for). I uninstall and reinstall the app to no avail. When it worked it was very accurate and it gave me great exposure settings. Oh, well you get what you pay for. **Response: it's just not reading
replyContent: Please try the new version I just published, it allows you to pick between the sensors on your device to find the most sensitive. Thanks!

content: Very accurate

Not accurate on Moto G6. Off by about 3 stops when compared to LunaPro SBC. But it can be calibrated to counteract the error. Incident seems to be fairly correct. Spot is erratic and slow to respond. At one point I moved the spot from light to dark area and the EV value went up! Too bad as the concept is good and the app is well designed from a usability standpoint. Too late to get my money back. The improve this app I would display all combinations of shutter speed and aperture simultaneously.
replyContent: Please contact me with your order number, happy to send a refund.

content: Just getting back into 35mm film photography... This app is coming in very handy to assist in settings
I use film cameras with dead meter, so this app is a lifesaver. Great app! Can't live without it!

Love this app, surprisingly accurate when using the camera sensor as opposed to the rear facing camera to judge exposure. The amount of features available are also very nice to have given the price and are also easy to use and accurate.
I use it mainly for shooting b&w film with high tolerances for over and underexposing. That said, I've found the app to be pretty accurate and very convenient.
Great app
very good app
Does what it says on the tin.
easy and simple to use
Now working on Samsung S10, thanks for the quick fix. Compared results on Canon 5D Mk2 and readings are spot on, no calibration needed.
easy peeazy
Excellent.
Best Android light meter app, it would be perfect if the image live preview change brightness when change Ev. Really need it, tks.
Good app. Plus I got that clear - my phone has an incident light sensor!
very happy with this
Greatest light meter found for Android. It would be great if there is a switch in the sensor meter to toggle the incident light (show only max value).

I liked this app enough to buy it, but, please fix the bugs. EV calculation 
doesn't work. EV values have to be set twice to update result. ISO and f 
stop selection list shows current out by one. A meter calibration feature 
would be welcome.
After Galaxy S8+ updated to Android 8 the camera meter has stopped working. Sensor meter still works but it's use is limited to me. Please find a fix this used to be the best meter app.
replyContent: I think I just pushed a fix, please let me know if it works.

content: Hi developer, I have a problem with the manual exposure calculation function. When I calculate for EV value in manual mode, no matter how much I changed shutter speed, aperture, and iso values, the EV value doesn't recalculate and update

Great app. Can you please add a focal length simulator to the light meter? For example I would like to enter the lens details of my phone's camera (28mm or whatever it is), enter my film type (35mm, 120, 5x7 etc) and camera lens focal length, and have the app adjust the FOV shown in the light meter to match more or less what my camera will see.

It really depends on which light sensor your phone has. For example the app was unusable on Lenovo TAB - very inaccurate and refreshed every 5 seconds. But on Samsung S7 this app really shines. Surprisingly accurate and reacts on light change within fraction of second. I also appreciate clean layout of menu and custom values. I am very satisfied.
